snippet: Investors are focusing more on politics and have become more selective in what they buy, the Bank for International Settlements said on Monday in its latest signal that markets may be breaking free from a dependence on central bank support....

headline.main: Opening a New Chapter at India's 'Grandmothers' School'
headline.print_headline: Opening a New Chapter at India's 'Grandmothers' School'

lead_paragraph: Investors are focusing more on politics and have become more selective in what they buy, the Bank for International Settlements said on Monday in its latest signal that markets may be breaking free from a dependence on central bank support.
